alert.note: Alert for Grundy; Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 17 at 3:19PM CST until February 17 at 5:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR EAST CENTRAL GRUNDY AND WEST CENTRAL WILL COUNTIES... At 319 PM CST, river gauge reports continue to indicate a significant ice jam on the Kankakee River downstream of Wilmington near I-55. HAZARD...Flash flooding from an ice jam. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Continued flooding of areas near and upstream of the ice jam. Potential rapid-onset flooding downstream of the ice jam if the ice jam breaks. Areas most likely to be affected by ice jam flooding include rural areas from near Wilmington to near I-55. If the ice jam breaks, areas downstream of I-55 near Phelan Acres could experience a rapid water level rise with little notice. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: A Flash Flood Warning means rapid-onset flooding is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along creeks, drainage ditches, and other waterways should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
